quiz.title: Unit 4: Measurement
quiz.subtitle: Fundamental Unit Conversions (20 Questions)
quiz.subject: Physics
quiz.topic: Basic Metric, Imperial, and Time Conversions

questions.question: A solution has a volume of 250 mL. How many liters is this?
questions.explanation: The prefix 'milli-' means 1/1000. So, 1 mL = 0.001 L. Therefore, 250 mL × (0.001 L / 1 mL) = 0.25 L.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using the SI system in science?
options: It is based on the number 12
It is used only in Europe
It provides a universal standard for clear communication
Its units are based on human body parts
questions.explanation: The primary advantage of the SI system is its role as a universal, coherent system of measurement that allows scientists around the world to share and compare data unambiguously.

questions.question: Convert 36 inches to feet.
questions.explanation: There are 12 inches in 1 foot. Therefore, 36 inches ÷ 12 inches/foot = 3 feet.

questions.question: A person weighs 150 pounds. What is their mass in kilograms? (1 kg ≈ 2.2 lb)
questions.explanation: Mass in kg = weight in pounds ÷ 2.2 = 150 lb ÷ 2.2 lb/kg ≈ 68.2 kg.

questions.question: Convert 5 kilograms to pounds. (1 kg ≈ 2.2 lb)
questions.explanation: Weight in pounds = mass in kg × 2.2 = 5 kg × 2.2 lb/kg = 11 lb.

questions.question: Convert 7.5 feet to inches.
questions.explanation: There are 12 inches in 1 foot. Therefore, 7.5 feet × 12 inches/foot = 90 inches.

questions.question: How many seconds are in 3 days?
questions.explanation: 1 day = 24 hours, 1 hour = 60 minutes, 1 minute = 60 seconds. So, 3 days × 24 h/day × 60 min/h × 60 s/min = 259,200 s.

A room measures 12 feet by 15 feet. What is its area in square meters? (1 ft = 0.3048 m)
questions.explanation: Area = 12 ft × 15 ft = 180 ft². Convert to m²: 180 ft² × (0.3048 m/ft)² = 180 × 0.0929 ≈ 16.72 m².
